subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: The St. Louis Cardinals tied a major league record with 10 hits in a row in a 10-run fifth inning, with pitcher Braden Looper and second baseman Aaron Miles getting two each in a 10-5 victory over the visiting San Diego Padres last night.
snippet: The St. Louis Cardinals tied a major league record with 10 hits in a row in a 10-run fifth inning, with pitcher Braden Looper and second baseman Aaron Miles getting two each in a 10-5 victory over the visiting San Diego Padres last night.
